title: Improve error messages with actionable guidance
description: Review and improve all error messages in bootstrap commands to make them more actionable. Replace generic errors with helpful guidance including: what went wrong, why it happened, common fixes with examples, and related commands to try. Focus on common errors like file not found, path issues, template detection failures.
notes:
MEDIUM IMPACT - Additional Support. Addresses 'Error Recovery & Troubleshooting' by making errors self-explanatory. Current error messages could be more helpful and actionable.

=== ERROR MESSAGE IMPROVEMENT ANALYSIS ===

**Current State**: Error messages exist but lack actionable guidance

**Identified Error Categories**:

1. **File Not Found Errors**
   - Current: "Error: Could not find specification document at [path]"
   - Issues: No guidance on why path failed, no suggestions for fixing
   - Common causes: Wrong path format, file in different location, typo in filename

2. **Directory Conflict Errors**
   - Current: "ERROR: Environment already exists"
   - Issues: No guidance on what to do next, no context about why this matters
   - Common causes: Re-running bootstrap in same directory, wrong directory

3. **Template Detection Issues**
   - Current: "Warning: Specification lacks clear indicators..."
   - Issues: Some guidance but could be more specific about what to add
   - Common causes: Vague spec, missing keywords, wrong template type

4. **Path Expansion Issues**
   - Current: No explicit error handling documented
   - Issues: Users don't understand ~ expansion, relative paths, iCloud paths
   - Common causes: Mac-specific path formats, spaces in paths, special characters

5. **Validation Failures**
   - Current: Generic warnings without resolution steps
   - Issues: User doesn't know how to fix the issue
   - Common causes: Empty files, wrong format, missing sections

=== ERROR MESSAGE IMPROVEMENT FRAMEWORK ===

**Standard Structure for All Errors**:

```
[ICON] [SEVERITY]: [What happened]

üìç Where: [Location/context]
üîç Why: [Root cause explanation]
üí° Fix: [Step-by-step resolution]
üîó Related: [Helpful commands or docs]
```

**Severity Levels**:
- ‚ùå ERROR: Cannot proceed, must fix
- ‚ö†Ô∏è  WARNING: Can proceed but should address
- ‚ÑπÔ∏è  INFO: Helpful context, no action needed

**Example Transformation**:

BEFORE:
```
Error: Could not find specification document at [path]
Please provide the path to your project specification (.md file from Claude Desktop)
```

AFTER:
```
‚ùå ERROR: Specification file not found

üìç Where: Looking for file at "~/project/spec.md"

üîç Why this happened:
   ‚Ä¢ File doesn't exist at this path
   ‚Ä¢ Path may have typo or incorrect location
   ‚Ä¢ File might be in a different folder

üí° How to fix:

1. Check if file exists:
   ls -la ~/project/spec.md

2. Common locations to check:
   ‚Ä¢ ~/Documents/spec.md
   ‚Ä¢ ~/Downloads/spec.md
   ‚Ä¢ ~/Desktop/spec.md
   ‚Ä¢ iCloud: ~/Library/Mobile Documents/com~apple~CloudDocs/

3. Use full path or relative path:
   /smart-bootstrap ~/Documents/my-spec.md
   /smart-bootstrap ./spec.md (if in same folder)

4. Let me search for it:
   Just provide the filename and I'll search common locations:
   /smart-bootstrap spec.md

üîó Related:
   ‚Ä¢ Mac paths guide: See .claude/reference/mac-user-workflow-guide.md
   ‚Ä¢ Create new spec: /create-spec
```

### 1. FILE NOT FOUND ERRORS

**Error 1A: Specification File Not Found (No fallback)**
```

1. **Verify file exists**:
   ls -la "[path_provided]"

**Error 1C: File Not Readable (Permissions)**
```
‚ùå ERROR: Cannot read specification file

üìç Where: "[path]"
   File exists but I don't have permission to read it.

üîç Why this happened:
   The file has restrictive permissions or is in a protected location.

   Common causes:
   ‚Ä¢ File owned by different user
   ‚Ä¢ File in system-protected directory
   ‚Ä¢ File encrypted or in secure location
   ‚Ä¢ macOS privacy restrictions

üí° How to fix:

1. **Check file permissions**:
   ls -la "[path]"
   
   Should show: -rw-r--r-- (readable by you)

2. **Fix permissions if needed**:
   chmod 644 "[path]"

3. **Move to accessible location**:
   cp "[path]" ~/Documents/spec.md
   /smart-bootstrap ~/Documents/spec.md

4. **Check macOS privacy settings**:
   System Settings ‚Üí Privacy & Security ‚Üí Files and Folders
   ‚Üí Ensure terminal/VS Code has access

üîó Related:
   ‚Ä¢ Mac permissions: /help mac-permissions
   ‚Ä¢ Alternative: Copy file content and paste directly
```

### 2. DIRECTORY CONFLICT ERRORS

**Error 2A: Environment Already Exists**
```
‚ùå ERROR: Claude Code environment already exists

üìç Where: [current_directory]/.claude/

üîç Why this happened:
   This directory already has a Claude Code environment set up.
   
   You're either:
   ‚Ä¢ Trying to re-bootstrap an existing project
   ‚Ä¢ In wrong directory
   ‚Ä¢ Previous bootstrap didn't complete but created .claude/

üí° How to fix:

Choose the right option for your situation:

**Option A: You're in the WRONG directory**
   cd /path/to/your/new/project
   /smart-bootstrap spec.md

**Option B: You want to START OVER in this directory**
   
   ‚ö†Ô∏è  WARNING: This deletes all existing tasks, context, and customizations!
   
   # Back up first (recommended)
   cp -r .claude .claude.backup
   
   # Remove environment
   rm -rf .claude CLAUDE.md README.md
   
   # Start fresh
   /smart-bootstrap spec.md

**Option C: You want to UPDATE the existing environment**
   
   The environment is already set up! You can:
   ‚Ä¢ Start working: /complete-task [id]
   ‚Ä¢ View tasks: cat .claude/tasks/task-overview.md
   ‚Ä¢ Update context: Edit .claude/context/overview.md
   ‚Ä¢ Add commands: Create .claude/commands/[name].md

**Option D: Previous bootstrap FAILED midway**
   
   If you interrupted a previous bootstrap:
   
   # Check what exists
   ls -la .claude/
   
   # If incomplete, remove and retry
   rm -rf .claude
   /smart-bootstrap spec.md

üîó Related:
   ‚Ä¢ Backup guide: /help backup-environment
   ‚Ä¢ Working with environments: See CLAUDE.md
```

**Error 2B: CLAUDE.md Exists (No .claude/)**
```
‚ö†Ô∏è  WARNING: CLAUDE.md file exists without .claude/ directory

üìç Where: [current_directory]/CLAUDE.md

üîç Why this happened:
   There's a CLAUDE.md file here but no .claude/ directory.
   
   Possible reasons:
   ‚Ä¢ Partial bootstrap that failed
   ‚Ä¢ Manual file creation
   ‚Ä¢ .claude/ directory was deleted but CLAUDE.md remained
   ‚Ä¢ Different project that uses CLAUDE.md for other purposes

üí° How to fix:

**Option A: This is an INCOMPLETE bootstrap**
   
   # Remove partial setup
   rm CLAUDE.md
   
   # Start fresh
   /smart-bootstrap spec.md

**Option B: This is a DIFFERENT project**
   
   # Back up existing file
   mv CLAUDE.md CLAUDE.md.old
   
   # Bootstrap new environment
   /smart-bootstrap spec.md
   
   # Your old CLAUDE.md is saved as CLAUDE.md.old

**Option C: You want to KEEP existing CLAUDE.md**
   
   # Bootstrap in subdirectory instead
   mkdir my-project
   cd my-project
   /smart-bootstrap ../spec.md

‚ö†Ô∏è  Note: CLAUDE.md is the main entry point for Claude Code.
   Having a different CLAUDE.md may cause confusion.

üîó Related:
   ‚Ä¢ CLAUDE.md purpose: See legacy-template-reference.md
   ‚Ä¢ Project structure: /help structure
```

### 3. TEMPLATE DETECTION ERRORS

**Error 3A: Vague Specification (Low confidence)**
```
‚ö†Ô∏è  WARNING: Specification too vague for auto-detection

üìç Issue: Template confidence below 50%
   Current scores:
   ‚Ä¢ Power Query: 15%
   ‚Ä¢ Research: 10%
   ‚Ä¢ Life Projects: 5%
   ‚Ä¢ Documentation: 5%
   ‚Ä¢ Base: 20% (default fallback)

üîç Why this happened:
   Your spec lacks clear indicators for template selection.
   
   I couldn't find strong signals for:
   ‚Ä¢ Project type (web app, data analysis, research, personal, docs)
   ‚Ä¢ Technology stack (specific tools/languages)
   ‚Ä¢ Domain keywords (regulatory, academic, fitness, API, etc.)
   
   Example of vague spec:
   "Build a project to work with data and create reports."
   
   vs. clear spec:
   "Research study analyzing remote work impact using Python statistical analysis with hypothesis testing."

üí° How to fix:

**Option A: ADD MORE DETAILS to your spec**
   
   Edit your spec.md and add:
   
   1. **Project type explicitly**:
      "This is a [research project / Power Query solution / personal fitness goal / API documentation project]"
   
   2. **Technology stack**:
      "Technologies: Python, pandas, scipy, Jupyter notebooks"
      or
      "Technologies: Power Query, M language, Excel 365"
   
   3. **Domain keywords**:
      Research: "research question", "hypothesis", "statistical analysis"
      Power Query: "regulatory calculation", "Excel workbook"
      Life: "my personal goal", "fitness journey", "track my progress"
      Documentation: "API documentation", "technical writing"
   
   Then retry: /smart-bootstrap spec.md

**Option B: USE CREATE-SPEC for guided creation**
   
   Start over with interactive builder:
   /create-spec
   
   This asks targeted questions and generates optimized spec.

**Option C: CHOOSE TEMPLATE MANUALLY**
   
   Tell me which template fits:
   
   1. **Power Query** - Excel calculations, regulatory compliance, M language
      Use if: CEM-06, pension calc, Tax forms, Benefits calculation
   
   2. **Research/Analysis** - Academic research, hypothesis testing, data science
      Use if: PhD project, experiments, statistical studies, literature review
   
   3. **Life Projects** - Personal goals, fitness, learning, home projects
      Use if: Marathon training, language learning, home organization
   
   4. **Documentation** - API docs, technical writing, knowledge bases
      Use if: Developer docs, user guides, API reference, tutorials
   
   5. **Base (General)** - Standard software projects, web/mobile apps
      Use if: React app, Node.js API, mobile app, generic software
   
   Say: "Use [template name] template"

üîó Related:
   ‚Ä¢ Template guide: .claude/reference/template-selection-rules.md
   ‚Ä¢ Spec examples: examples/specifications/templates/
   ‚Ä¢ Create optimized spec: /create-spec

### 4. PATH AND FILE FORMAT ERRORS

**Error 4A: Path with Spaces**
```
‚ùå ERROR: Path contains spaces without quotes

üìç Where: [path_provided]

üîç Why this happened:
   Paths with spaces need to be quoted or escaped in shell commands.
   
   You provided:
   /smart-bootstrap ~/My Documents/project spec.md
   
   Shell interprets this as:
   ~/My, Documents/project, spec.md (three separate arguments)

üí° How to fix:

**Use quotes around the full path**:
   /smart-bootstrap "~/My Documents/project spec.md"
   
   or
   
   /smart-bootstrap '~/My Documents/project spec.md'

**Use escape characters** (backslash before spaces):
   /smart-bootstrap ~/My\ Documents/project\ spec.md

**Use tab completion** (avoids manual typing):
   /smart-bootstrap ~/My[TAB] (shell auto-completes with escapes)

**Rename file to avoid spaces** (recommended):
   mv "~/My Documents/project spec.md" ~/Documents/project-spec.md
   /smart-bootstrap ~/Documents/project-spec.md

üí° Pro tip: File paths without spaces are less error-prone!
   Use hyphens or underscores: project-spec.md, my_project.md

üîó Related:
   ‚Ä¢ Mac path guide: .claude/reference/mac-user-workflow-guide.md
   ‚Ä¢ Shell basics: /help shell-paths
```

### 5. GIT AND VERSION CONTROL ERRORS

**Error 5A: Git Conflict During Bootstrap**
```
‚ö†Ô∏è  WARNING: Git repository detected with uncommitted changes

üìç Where: [current_directory]/.git

üîç Why this happened:
   You're bootstrapping in a git repository that has:
   ‚Ä¢ Uncommitted changes
   ‚Ä¢ Untracked files
   
   Bootstrap will create many new files (.claude/, CLAUDE.md, etc.)
   which will show up in git status.

üí° How to proceed:

**Option A: COMMIT current changes first** (recommended):
   
   git status
   git add .
   git commit -m "Checkpoint before Claude Code bootstrap"
   
   Then bootstrap:
   /smart-bootstrap spec.md
   
   After bootstrap:
   git add .claude/ CLAUDE.md README.md
   git commit -m "Add Claude Code environment"

**Option B: STASH changes temporarily**:
   
   git stash
   /smart-bootstrap spec.md
   git add .claude/ CLAUDE.md README.md
   git commit -m "Add Claude Code environment"
   git stash pop

**Option C: CONTINUE anyway**:
   
   Bootstrap will proceed but you'll have mixed changes:
   ‚Ä¢ Your existing uncommitted work
   ‚Ä¢ New Claude Code files
   
   You can separate them later with:
   git add .claude/ CLAUDE.md README.md
   git commit -m "Add Claude Code environment"

üí° Pro tip: Add .claude/ to version control!
   This allows you to:
   ‚Ä¢ Track task progress
   ‚Ä¢ Share project context with team
   ‚Ä¢ Version control your workflow

üîó Related:
   ‚Ä¢ Git workflow: /help git-integration
   ‚Ä¢ Gitignore setup: See .gitignore template
```
